meanings.definition: To go beyond the limits of
meanings.sent1: She tried to transcend her fear of heights by climbing a small ladder.
meanings.sent2: The athlete's determination helped him transcend his previous record in the race.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to transcend its laziness by chasing a laser pointer.
meanings.sent4: Her voice seemed to transcend the room, filling it with warmth and melody.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the sky with colors that seemed to transcend imagination.

meanings.sent1: The student's grades transcended all expectations this semester.
meanings.sent2: The beauty of the garden transcended anything she had ever seen before.
meanings.sent3: The cake was so delicious, it seemed to transcend the laws of baking.
meanings.sent4: His kindness transcended mere politeness, touching everyone he met.
meanings.sent5: The mountain peak transcended all others, standing tall and majestic.

meanings.definition: To rise above or go beyond the ordinary
meanings.sent1: Her kindness and generosity transcended any material possessions she had.
meanings.sent2: The artist's work transcended mere paint and canvas, evoking deep emotions.
meanings.sent3: The dog's ability to fetch transcended the usual expectations of a pet.
meanings.sent4: His wisdom seemed to transcend his years, surprising all who knew him.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's performance transcended mere movement, telling a story with grace.
